name: qlaxr5i
params: class c0, class c1, class c2
body: |- wceq(co(c0, chj, c1), co(c2, chj, c1))

stmt.origin: a1ii(wceq(co(c0, chj, c1), co(c2, chj, c1)), wcel(c0, cch))

body.origin:
|- wceq(co(c0, chj, c1), co(c2, chj, c1))
-| wceq(co(c0, chj, c1), co(c2, chj, c1))
-| wcel(c0, cch)

cumulated.origin:
|- wceq(co(c0, chj, c1), co(c2, chj, c1))
-| wceq(co(c0, chj, c1), co(c2, chj, c1))
-| wcel(c0, cch)

stmt.origin: a1ii(wceq(co(c0, chj, c1), co(c2, chj, c1)), wcel(c2, cch))

body.origin:
|- wceq(co(c0, chj, c1), co(c2, chj, c1))
-| wceq(co(c0, chj, c1), co(c2, chj, c1))
-| wcel(c2, cch)

cumulated.origin:
|- wceq(co(c0, chj, c1), co(c2, chj, c1))
-| wcel(c0, cch)
-| wceq(co(c0, chj, c1), co(c2, chj, c1))
-| wcel(c2, cch)

stmt.origin: a1ii(wceq(co(c0, chj, c1), co(c2, chj, c1)), wcel(c1, cch))

body.origin:
|- wceq(co(c0, chj, c1), co(c2, chj, c1))
-| wceq(co(c0, chj, c1), co(c2, chj, c1))
-| wcel(c1, cch)

cumulated.origin:
|- wceq(co(c0, chj, c1), co(c2, chj, c1))
-| wcel(c0, cch)
-| wcel(c2, cch)
-| wceq(co(c0, chj, c1), co(c2, chj, c1))
-| wcel(c1, cch)
cumulated.pretty:
⊢ (c0[vH]c1)=(c2[vH]c1)
⊣ c0 ∈ CH
⊣ c2 ∈ CH
⊣ (c0[vH]c1)=(c2[vH]c1)
⊣ c1 ∈ CH

body.origin:
|- wceq(co(c0, chj, c1), co(c2, chj, c1))
-| wceq(c0, c2)

cumulated.origin:
|- wceq(co(c0, chj, c1), co(c2, chj, c1))
-| wcel(c0, cch)
-| wcel(c2, cch)
-| wcel(c1, cch)
-| wceq(c0, c2)
cumulated.pretty:
⊢ (c0[vH]c1)=(c2[vH]c1)
⊣ c0 ∈ CH
⊣ c2 ∈ CH
⊣ c1 ∈ CH
⊣ c0 = c2

comment: One of the conditions showing ` CH ` is an ortholattice. (This corresponds to axiom "ax-r5" in the Quantum Logic Explorer.) (Contributed by NM, 4-Aug-2004.) (New usage is discouraged.)
